catalog.name: Plants
catalog.description:
This collection includes information on energy production plants (RES and NO-RES) at different levels of spatial aggregation over the years, useful for a characterization of the current state of the energy system and for the analysis of its potential developments. This data can include valuable inputs to models for spatial energy planning.
Stock photo by Vecteezy

members.name: FER
members.description: This collection includes data relating to Renewable Energy Sources plants present on the national territory referred to different levels of spatial aggregation in different years.

members.name: Hydroelectric
members.description: This collection includes data relating to hydroelectric plants present on the national territory referred to different levels of spatial aggregation in different years.

members.name: Hydroelectric - Dams
members.description:
Map of dams (reference year 2020) from the HESCI Database including reservoir-fed hydroelectric plants.
The data of the Italian tanks collected in the database of Italian tanks presented in A. Frigerio, M. Meghella, G. Bruno, G. Stella, «Evaluation of the energy storage potential of hydroelectric pumped storage plants for the Italian electricity system», RSE - RdS Report, Milan, 2011 , have been retrieved and reorganised. The information entered in the database was obtained from the following sources: • The database of the Italian Dam Registry (www.registroitalianodighe.it) which collects information relating to large Italian dams such as position, type, height and reservoir volume according to Law 584/94, authorized reservoir volume, maximum regulation and authorized height, concessionaire; • The “Seismic Feelings” and “Costs/Benefits” databases that have been developed within the System Research in the past years. The first identifies, for a given seismic event, the dams to be subjected to control according to the indications of the Italian Dam Registry; the second provides in the aftermath an evaluation of the costs/benefits of Italian dams in order to improve the social acceptance of the presence of the plant on the territory; • The volumes "The retention dams of Italian hydroelectric plants", drawn up by the ANIDEL commission (National Association of Electricity Producers and Distributors) in 1961 and, subsequently, by ENEL in 1974; • The 'Progetto Dighe' website (www.progettodighe.it) edited and updated by a group of enthusiasts of dams, hydroelectric plants and hydraulic works, which stands out for the completeness of the data. The database in the "SKYdam" section contains, in fact, as many as 577 dams not only italian, but also french, american and swiss. A card shows both their main characteristics and a Google Maps map with the geographical position.

members.name: Reservoirs
members.description:
Map of reservoirs (reference year 2020), starting from the HESCI Database which includes hydroelectric plants fueled by reservoirs.
The data of the Italian tanks collected in the database of Italian tanks presented in A. Frigerio, M. Meghella, G. Bruno, G. Stella, «Evaluation of the energy storage potential of hydroelectric pumped storage plants for the Italian electricity system», RSE - RdS Report, Milan, 2011 have been retrieved and reorganised. The information entered in the database was obtained from the following sources: • The database of the Italian Dam Registry (www.registroitalianodighe.it) which collects information relating to the large Italian dams such as position, type, height and volume of reservoir according to Law 584/94, authorized reservoir volume, maximum regulation and authorized height, concessionaire; • The “Seismic Feelings” and “Costs/Benefits” databases that have been developed within the System Research in the past years. The first identifies, for a given seismic event, the dams to be subjected to control according to the indications of the Italian Dam Registry; The volumes "The retention dams of Italian hydroelectric plants", drawn up by the ANIDEL commission (National Association of Electricity Producers and Distributors) in 1961 and, after, by ENEL in 1974; • The volumes "The retention dams of Italian hydroelectric plants", drawn up by the ANIDEL commission (National Association of Electricity Producers and Distributors) in 1961 and, after, by ENEL in 1974; • The Dam Project website (www.progettodighe.it) edited and updated by a group of enthusiasts of dams, hydroelectric power plants and hydraulic works, which stands out for the completeness of the data. The database in the "SKYdam" section contains, in fact, as many as 577 dams not only italian, but also french, american and swiss. A slide shows both their main characteristics and a Google Maps map with the geographical position.

members.name: Hydroelectric plants
members.description:
Map of hydroelectric plants (reference year 2020), starting from the HESCI Database which includes hydroelectric plants fueled by reservoirs.
The data of the Italian tanks collected in the database of Italian tanks presented in A. Frigerio, M. Meghella, G. Bruno, G. Stella, «Evaluation of the energy storage potential of hydroelectric pumped storage plants for the Italian electricity system», RSE - RdS Report, Milan, 2011 have been retrieved and reorganised. The information entered in the database was obtained from the following sources: • The database of the Italian Dam Registry(www.registroitalianodighe.it) which collects information relating to the large Italian dams such as position, type, height and volume of reservoir according to Law 584/94, authorized reservoir volume, maximum regulation and authorized height, concessionaire; • The “Seismic Feelings” and “Costs/Benefits” databases that have been developed within the System Research in the past years. The first identifies, for a given seismic event, the dams to be subjected to control according to the indications of the Italian Dam Registry; the second provides a subsequent evaluation of the costs/benefits of Italian dams in order to improve the social acceptance of the presence of the plant on the territory; • The volumes "The retention dams of Italian hydroelectric plants", drawn up by the ANIDEL commission (National Association of Electricity Producers and Distributors) in 1961 and, after, by ENEL in 1974; • The Dam Project website (www.progettodighe.it)edited and updated by a group of enthusiasts of dams, hydroelectric power plants and hydraulic works, which stands out for the completeness of the data. The database in the "SKYdam" section contains, in fact, as many as 577 dams not only italian, but also french, american and swiss. A card shows both their main characteristics and a Google Maps map with the geographical position.

members.name: Biomass - Provincial electricity production from biogas (GWh)
members.description:
Map of production from biogas plants at provincial level, expressed in GWh, over the years.
The provincial production from bioliquids, biogas, biodegradable urban waste and solid biomass (other than waste) was calculated starting from the percentage production data on the national total.
Due to rounding in the starting data, in some cases, the sum of the production from bioliquids, biogas, biodegradable urban waste and solid biomass (other than waste) of a given province does not coincide with the total biomass production (including all types) of the province itself (statistical data provided by TERNA).
RSE processing starting from GSE, TERNA and ISTAT data (administrative boundaries).

featureInfoTemplate.template:
Provincial production from biogas (GWh) {{valore}}

metadata link

View historical chart

members.name: Biomass - Provincial electricity production from biodegradable RU (GWh)
members.description:
Map of production from biodegradable urban waste plants at the provincial level, expressed in GWh, over the years.
The provincial production from bioliquids, biogas, biodegradable urban waste and solid biomass (other than waste) was calculated starting from the data of percentage production of the national total.
Due to rounding in the starting data, in some cases, the sum of the production from bioliquids, biogas, biodegradable urban waste and solid biomass (other than waste) of a given province does not coincide with the total biomass production (including all types) of the province itself (statistical data provided by TERNA).
RSE elaborations starting from GSE, TERNA and ISTAT data (administrative boundaries).

Map of production from bioliquid plants at provincial level, expressed in GWh, over the years.
The provincial production from bioliquids, biogas, biodegradable urban waste and solid biomass (other than waste) was calculated starting from the percentage production data on the national total.
Due to rounding in the starting data, in some cases, the sum of the production from bioliquids, biogas, biodegradable urban waste and solid biomass (other than waste) of a given province does not coincide with the total biomass production (including all types) of the province itself (statistical data provided by TERNA).
RSE processing starting from GSE, TERNA and ISTAT data (administrative boundaries).

Provincial production from bioliquids (GWh) {{valore}}

members.name: Biomass - Provincial electricity production from solid biomass other than waste (GWh)
members.description:
Map of production from solid biomass plants other than waste at provincial level, expressed in GWh, over the years.
The provincial production from bioliquids, biogas, biodegradable urban waste and solid biomass (other than waste) was calculated starting from the percentage production data on the national total.
Due to rounding off of the starting data, in some cases, the the sum of the production from bioliquids, biogas, biodegradable urban waste and solid biomass (other than waste) of a given province does not coincide with the total production from biomass (including all types) of the province itself (statistical data provided by TERNA).
RSE elaborations starting from GSE, TERNA and ISTAT data (administrative boundaries).

members.description: This collection includes the characteristics of potential existing hydroelectric pumping plants that can be installed in the area.

members.name: Existing pumping
members.description: This collection includes the characteristics of the hydroelectric pumping plants present in the area.

members.name: Existing hydroelectric pumped storage plants
members.description:
Municipal-scale map of the capacity (in pumped storage) of existing pumped-storage hydroelectric plants.
In addition to pumping power, turbine power data (MW), storage capacity (MWh) are also associated with individual plants

members.name: Potential pumping
members.description: This collection includes the characteristics of potential hydroelectric pumping plants that can be installed in the area.

members.name: Pumped-storage hydroelectric plants - realizable potential municipal power (MW)
members.description:
Municipal map of installable pumping potential (power expressed in MW). The potential refers to potential new pumped storage plants, economically feasible with a payback period of less than 15 years.

The calculated potential concerns the following types of plants:

  • traditional pumping, i.e. between existing reservoirs and new reservoirs;

  • marine pumping, i.e. where the sea is exploited as a lower reservoir;

  • underground pumping, i.e. with one of the reservoirs built in cave

  • pumping between existing lakes.

Additional information: Reports RSE RdS prot. 11000299, 12000959, 16002842, 17000266. Evaluations year 2015.​

members.name: Pumped-storage hydroelectric plants - realizable potential - Storage capacity (MWh)
members.description:
Municipal level map of potential storage capacity (MWh). The potential, expressed in storage capacity, refers to new pumping plants, economically feasible with a payback period of less than 15 years.

The calculated potential concerns the following types of plants:

  • traditional pumping, i.e. between existing reservoirs and new reservoirs;

  • marine pumping, i.e. where the sea is exploited as a lower reservoir;

  • underground pumping, i.e. with one of the reservoirs built in cave

  • pumping between existing lakes.

Additional information: Reports RSE RdS prot. 11000299, 12000959, 16002842, 17000266. Evaluations year 2015.​

members.name: Hydroelectric pumping plants - Installable power compatible with energy scenarios (MW)
members.description:
Municipal map of the installable pumping capacity (MW), referring to new pumping plants selected in the context of the studies for the achievement of the objectives in the energy scenarios.

The potential concerns the following plant types:

  • traditional pumping, i.e. between existing reservoirs and new reservoirs (also called double reservoir);

  • marine pumping, i.e. where the sea is exploited as a lower reservoir;

In addition to the pumping power that can be installed, turbine power (MW) and storage capacity (MWh) data are also associated with the individual plants.​

Additional information: RSE RdS report prot. 20000116
